snippet: Weapons experts and diplomats say that if President Bashar al-Assad is serious about giving up his arsenal, he will have to take dramatic action in the coming weeks.
abstract: Weapons experts and diplomats say that if Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad is serious about giving up his chemical weapons arsenal he will have to take dramatic action promptly; anything short of an immediate demonstration of willingness will be taken as a sign that Assad is seeking to drag out the process.

byline.original: By WILLIAM J. BROAD and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: William J. Broad reported from New York, and David E. Sanger from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Weapons experts and diplomats say that if President Bashar al-Assad is serious about giving up his arsenal, he will have to take dramatic action in the coming weeks.

headline.main: If History Is Any Measure, the Clock Is Ticking
headline.print_headline: If History Is Any Measure, the Clock Is Ticking
